comments.body:
I find ZeroNet not very secure with stored keys/certificate. If your computer is stolen, your ZN identity is compromised. There is several solutions :
- propose to not store private keys on disk (require to paste it every time you need it)
- stored all private data in an encrypted db (require to unlock this db on start or web login)
- incite user to install ZeroNet on an encrypted filesystem (a simpler solution but could be acceptable)
